note.body:
```mermaid
graph LR
id0([DocBook])
id1{{HTML with translations}}
id2{{DevHelp}}
id0 --> id1
id0 --> id2

v.s.

target_title: Decide what to do about the user manual

note.body:
What about pagination?

In wip/manual-in-markdown, how is `help/chapter1-intro.md`, the first chapter, linked to the others?

target_title: GTK-Doc Manual Review

note.body:
There are not only changes in form, but also changes in substance.

[wip/manual-in-markdown](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk-doc/-/tree/wip/manual-in-markdown),
for example, still refer to the five main steps of GTK-Doc while the template step was removed in 2017.

DocBook can be turned programmatically into Markdown thanks to XSLT and Pandoc.
The better the Docbook, the better the resulting Markdown.

target_title: Refactor for intermediate files
Populate default annotations when missing

note.body:
GTK-Doc and GObject Introspection are two different things. Don't count on them to do each other's work.

Not seeing an annotation in GTK-Doc generated documentation means GObject Introspection sane default applies.

Good developers document their code well and add the right annotations. GTK-Doc will be sure to display them.

target_title: doc: Display of arg_data for GOptionEntry is wong

note.body:
Keep the parameter description short and
take all the space needed in the body to explain the guts.

```
 * @arg_type: some #FooBar
 * @arg_data: Depending on @arg_type, a pointer to a #GOptionArgFunc callback function 
 * or a pointer to a location to store the value.
 *
 * (In the body)
 * If the @arg type is %G_OPTION_ARG_CALLBACK, then @arg_data must point to
 * blah blah blah
 * ...
 */
```

target_title: Force user to provide replacement API with Deprecated tag

note.body:
No obligation, please. A recommendation is enough.

The current format:

    /**
     * ...
     * Deprecated: Version: Description
     */

with optional nonetheless recommended version and description fields is enough.

This a won't fix issue.

target_title: [RFC] how to present protected symbols

note.body: In GObject world there is no such thing as protected scope.

target_title: improve boxed types support

note.body:
Boxed, enum and flag types appear in the hierarchy.

GTKDOC_TYPE_BOXED and gtkdoc_boxed_get_type(), for example, are in `<SUBSECTION Standard>`.

This must be an outdated bug report.

target_title: Decide what to do about the user manual

note.body:
What kind of manual is [GTK-Doc manual](help/manual/C/index.docbook)?

GNOME user manual?
Translations required.
Read with Yelp;
installed under `$XDG_DATA_DIRS/help/`;
_Mallard_ or _DocBook_ format.
For GUI applications.

Developer manual?
No translations.
Read with DevHelp;
installed under `$XDG_DATA_DIRS/devhelp/books/`;
_HTML_ and _DevHelp index_ format.
Read with man;
installed under `$XDG_DATA_DIRS/man/`;
_troff_ format.
For library API and CLI.

A book about GTK-Doc?
Literary style. Catchy, rousing, captivating.
Printed on paper.
To read in public transport going to the office.
Digressions about GTK-Doc history and software development.
Examples: "The C Programming Language" by Kernighan and Ritchie,
"The Meson manual" by Pakkanen.
HTML version available on GTK-Doc website (like [this 
one](https://web.archive.org/web/20200101171246/https://developer.gnome.org/gtk-doc-manual/unstable/index.html.en) or [that
one](https://gtk-doc-ahmed-baizid-0-6755e25f5e40f1c03d23dde4d60db5600afac451.pages.gitlab.gnome.org/index.html
)),
locally under `$XDG_DATA_DIRS/gtk-doc/manual/`.
_DocBook_ format is fine.

GTK-Doc is not a GUI application, and it has no API.

target_title: Decide what to do about the user manual

note.body:
What are the grievances against DocBook?

- Read by Yelp. No conversion.
- DocBook stylesheets convert to HTML.
- DocBook stylesheets and GTK-DOC itself convert to DevHelp.
- DocBook stylesheets and FOP convert to PDF.
- DocBook stylesheets convert to man pages.
- Pandoc converts to Markdown.
- Rich semantic, intended for technical documentation.
- WYSIWYG editors available. 
  Example: [XXE](https://www.xmlmind.com/xmleditor/).

target_title: help: start to convert the manual to Markdown

note.body:
## Chunked Markdown

In `gtk-doc/help/manual/C`:


Normalize things:
```
$ L="index.docbook fdl-appendix.xml"
$ for f in $L; do xmllint --format --encode UTF-8 --output $f.tmp $f && mv $f.tmp $f; done
```

Chunk the manual:

```
$ cat chunk.xsl
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="2.0">
  <xsl:template match="/book/*">
    <xsl:result-document href="{@id}.docbook">
      <book>
        <xsl:copy-of select="current()"/>
      </book>
    </xsl:result-document>
  </xsl:template>
</xsl:stylesheet>

$ java -jar /usr/share/java/Saxon-HE.jar -s:index.docbook -xsl:chunk.xsl

$ ls *.docbook
contrib.docbook             faq.docbook    introduction.docbook  reports.docbook
documenting.docbook         fdl.docbook    metafiles.docbook     settingup.docbook
documenting-others.docbook  index.docbook  modernizing.docbook
```

Transform to Markdown:
```
$ for f in *.docbook; do xmllint --format --encode UTF-8 --output $f.tmp $f && mv $f.tmp $f; done

$ for f in *.docbook; do pandoc -f docbook -o ${f%.docbook}.md -s $f; done

$ ls *.md
contrib.md      documenting-others.md  fdl.md           metafiles.md    reports.md
documenting.md  faq.md                 introduction.md  modernizing.md  settingup.md
```

Any loses?
```
$ for f in *.md; do pandoc -t docbook4 -o ${f%.md}.xml -s $f; done

$ for f in *.docbook; do meld $f ${f%.docbook}.xml; done
```
DocBook is much more semantic than Markdown.

If something doesn't suit in the generated Markdowns, change the DocBook and regenerate.
For example, if other filenames are preferred, change the `<chapter/>` IDs.

target_title: Decide what to do about the user manual

note.body:
Some pandoc commands:

```
$ pandoc --from docbook --to markdown_strict -o chapter1.md chapter1.docbook
$ pandoc --from markdown_strict --to docbook -o test.docbook chapter1.md
```

Note: pandoc also supports the "docbook5" format.

target_title: The devhelp2 file is not generated

note.body:
I have tried `<xsl:template match="*"/>`. HTML and DevHelp files get generated but the content is not right.

The problem may be our customization of the DocBook stylesheets, i.e. `/usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl`.

Can you simplify it to the extreme:
```
$ cat /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0">
  <xsl:import href="http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/xsl/current/html/chunk.xsl"/>
  <xsl:include href="devhelp2.xsl"/>
  <xsl:param name="chunker.output.encoding" select="'UTF-8'"/>
  <xsl:template match="book|article">
    <xsl:apply-imports/>
    <xsl:call-template name="generate.devhelp2"/>
  </xsl:template>
</xsl:stylesheet>
```

This puzzles me... The XPath expression is not working...

```
gucharmap/build/docs/reference/html$ xmllint --xpath 'book|article' ../gucharmap-docs.sgml |head -3

With this:
```
$ diff -u /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl{.orig,}
--- /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl.orig    Thu Oct 17 01:32:11 2024
+++ /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl Thu Oct 17 02:04:32 2024
@@ -292,22 +292,7 @@

-  <xsl:template match="book|article">

-      <xsl:call-template name="version-greater-or-equal">
-        <xsl:with-param name="ver1" select="$VERSION" />
-        <xsl:with-param name="ver2">1.36</xsl:with-param>
-      </xsl:call-template>
-    </xsl:variable>
-    <xsl:if test="$tooldver = 0">
-      <xsl:message terminate="yes">
-FATAL-ERROR: You need the DocBook XSL Stylesheets version 1.36 or higher
-to build the documentation.
-Get a newer version at http://docbook.sourceforge.net/projects/xsl/
-      </xsl:message>
-    </xsl:if>
-    <xsl:apply-imports/>
-
+  <xsl:template match="book">

$
```

target_title: The devhelp2 file is not generated

note.body:
I did this:
```
$ diff -u /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl{.orig,}
--- /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl.orig    Thu Oct 17 01:32:11 2024
+++ /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl Thu Oct 17 01:35:31 2024
@@ -293,21 +293,6 @@
   <!-- template to create the index.sgml anchor index -->
 
   <xsl:template match="book|article">
-    <xsl:variable name="tooldver">
-      <xsl:call-template name="version-greater-or-equal">
-        <xsl:with-param name="ver1" select="$VERSION" />
-        <xsl:with-param name="ver2">1.36</xsl:with-param>
-      </xsl:call-template>
-    </xsl:variable>
-    <xsl:if test="$tooldver = 0">
-      <xsl:message terminate="yes">
-FATAL-ERROR: You need the DocBook XSL Stylesheets version 1.36 or higher
-to build the documentation.
-Get a newer version at http://docbook.sourceforge.net/projects/xsl/
-      </xsl:message>
-    </xsl:if>
-    <xsl:apply-imports/>
-
     <!-- generate $book.devhelp2 -->
     <xsl:call-template name="generate.devhelp2"/>
   </xsl:template>
$
```
And the result of the `xsltproc` run is same as before: all `html` files generated, no `devhelp2` file, the `xsltproc` output same as before.

But when I tried this instead:
```
$ diff -u /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl{.orig,}
--- /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl.orig    Thu Oct 17 01:32:11 2024
+++ /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl Thu Oct 17 01:40:47 2024
@@ -292,22 +292,7 @@
   <!-- ========================================================= -->
   <!-- template to create the index.sgml anchor index -->
 
-  <xsl:template match="book|article">
-    <xsl:variable name="tooldver">
-      <xsl:call-template name="version-greater-or-equal">
-        <xsl:with-param name="ver1" select="$VERSION" />
-        <xsl:with-param name="ver2">1.36</xsl:with-param>
-      </xsl:call-template>
-    </xsl:variable>
-    <xsl:if test="$tooldver = 0">
-      <xsl:message terminate="yes">
-FATAL-ERROR: You need the DocBook XSL Stylesheets version 1.36 or higher
-to build the documentation.
-Get a newer version at http://docbook.sourceforge.net/projects/xsl/
-      </xsl:message>
-    </xsl:if>
-    <xsl:apply-imports/>
-
+  <xsl:template match="*">
     <!-- generate $book.devhelp2 -->
     <xsl:call-template name="generate.devhelp2"/>
   </xsl:template>
$
```
then I've got the `book.devhelp2` file (and nothing else):
```
$ head book.devhelp2 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" standalone="no"?>
<book xmlns="http://www.devhelp.net/book" title="" link="index.html" author="" name="" version="2" language="c">
  <functions>
    <keyword type="function" name="gucharmap_codepoint_list_get_char ()" link="GucharmapCodepointList.html#gucharmap-codepoint-list-get-char"/>
    <keyword type="function" name="gucharmap_codepoint_list_get_index ()" link="GucharmapCodepointList.html#gucharmap-codepoint-list-get-index"/>
    <keyword type="function" name="gucharmap_codepoint_list_get_last_index ()" link="GucharmapCodepointList.html#gucharmap-codepoint-list-get-last-index"/>
    <keyword type="struct" name="struct GucharmapCodepointList" link="GucharmapCodepointList.html#GucharmapCodepointList-struct"/>
    <keyword type="function" name="gucharmap_block_chapters_model_new ()" link="GucharmapBlockChaptersModel.html#gucharmap-block-chapters-model-new"/>
    <keyword type="struct" name="struct GucharmapBlockChaptersModel" link="GucharmapBlockChaptersModel.html#GucharmapBlockChaptersModel-struct"/>
    <keyword type="function" name="gucharmap_block_codepoint_list_new ()" link="gucharmap-gucharmap-block-codepoint-list.html#gucharmap-block-codepoint-list-new"/>
$
```

target_title: The devhelp2 file is not generated

note.body:
You cannot change the stylesheet that way...

But you can remove but the DevHelp stuff:
```
--- a/gtk-doc.xsl
+++ b/gtk-doc.xsl
@@ -293,21 +293,6 @@
   <!-- template to create the index.sgml anchor index -->
 
   <xsl:template match="book|article">
-    <xsl:variable name="tooldver">
-      <xsl:call-template name="version-greater-or-equal">
-        <xsl:with-param name="ver1" select="$VERSION" />
-        <xsl:with-param name="ver2">1.36</xsl:with-param>
-      </xsl:call-template>
-    </xsl:variable>
-    <xsl:if test="$tooldver = 0">
-      <xsl:message terminate="yes">
-FATAL-ERROR: You need the DocBook XSL Stylesheets version 1.36 or higher
-to build the documentation.
-Get a newer version at http://docbook.sourceforge.net/projects/xsl/
-      </xsl:message>
-    </xsl:if>
-    <xsl:apply-imports/>
-
     <!-- generate $book.devhelp2 -->
     <xsl:call-template name="generate.devhelp2"/>
   </xsl:template>
```
and then:
```
gucharmap/build/docs/reference/html$ rm *
gucharmap/build/docs/reference/html$ xsltproc -v --xinclude /usr/local/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl ../gucharmap-docs.sgml &>log
gucharmap/build/docs/reference/html$ ls -l
total 44416
-rw-rw-r-- 1 ahmed ahmed    23438 oct.  17 00:23 book.devhelp2
-rw-rw-r-- 1 ahmed ahmed 45456062 oct.  17 00:23 log

```
Only the DevHelp file is generated, no HTML. The log is 5 times smaller.

Can you execute:
```
gucharmap/build/docs/reference/html$ xsltproc -v --xinclude /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl ../gucharmap-docs.sgml &> gtk-doc.log
gucharmap/build/docs/reference/html$ gzip gtk-doc.log 
```
And email me `gtk-doc.log.gz`? It's about ten megabytes.

target_title: The devhelp2 file is not generated

note.body:
I dug into history a bit and it looks like `devhelp2` worked here but long time ago (many years).  So it looks like it makes no sense to downgrade.

There are following two (still unresolved) reports with very similar issue:
- https://github.com/mesonbuild/meson/issues/2028
- https://github.com/mesonbuild/meson/issues/5843

I tried to debug a bit - OpenIndiana:
```
$ xsltproc -v --xinclude /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl ../gucharmap-docs.sgml 2>&1 | grep devhelp2
xsltParseStylesheetTemplate: mode generate.devhelp2.toc.mode
added pattern : '*' mode 'generate.devhelp2.toc.mode' priority -0.500000
xsltParseStylesheetTemplate: mode generate.devhelp2.index.mode
added pattern : '*' mode 'generate.devhelp2.index.mode' priority -0.500000

call-template returned: name generate.devhelp2

So it looks like the `xsltproc` does not call the template.

target_title: test suite fails in `test-gobject-mkhtml`: could not load ../../examples/gobject.c

note.body:
@kloczek could you please paste output from `xsltproc --version` on a machine where this fails?

I see the same issue with latest toolchain at OpenIndiana:
```
$ xsltproc --version
Using libxml 21304, libxslt 10142 and libexslt 823
xsltproc was compiled against libxml 21303, libxslt 10142 and libexslt 823
libxslt 10142 was compiled against libxml 21303
libexslt 823 was compiled against libxml 21303
$

However, I'm not sure if the `libxml`/`libxslt` version matters here.

target_title: The devhelp2 file is not generated

note.body:
`gtkdoc-mkhtml` does nothing more than use `xsltproc` to apply `gtk-doc.xsl` to the master document.

Check things are in place:

```
gucharmap/build/docs/reference/html$ ls -1 /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/
devhelp2.xsd
devhelp2.xsl
gtk-doc.xsl
version-greater-or-equal.xsl
...

gucharmap/build/docs/reference/html$ grep -C1 devhelp /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl 
  <xsl:import href="http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/xsl/current/html/chunk.xsl"/>
  <xsl:include href="devhelp2.xsl"/>
  <xsl:include href="version-greater-or-equal.xsl"/>
--

    <!-- generate $book.devhelp2 -->
    <xsl:call-template name="generate.devhelp2"/>
  </xsl:template>
```

And let us do it with bare `xsltproc`, without Meson, without GTK-Doc:

```
gucharmap/build/docs/reference/html$ rm *
gucharmap/build/docs/reference/html$ xsltproc --xinclude /usr/share/gtk-doc/data/gtk-doc.xsl ../gucharmap-docs.sgml

Writing ch01.html for chapter
Writing index.html for book(index)
Writing book.devhelp2 for book(index)
$ 
```

note.body: Hmmm, then I've no idea :-(.   Anyway, the result for `brasero` and `gucharmap` is same here (and I assume the root cause is same too), so it is enough to solve the missing `*.devhelp2` file for `gucharmap` only.  I mentioned `brasero` just as an example of an autotools based software to show that the problem is probably not in `meson` itself.

target_title: The devhelp2 file is not generated

note.body:
I'm on latest (rolling) OpenIndiana Hipster.  My build steps for `gucharmap`:

```
$ git clone https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gucharmap.git
$ cd gucharmap/
$ sed -i -e '/symbolic-functions/d' meson.build
$ PATH=/usr/gnu/bin/:$PATH meson setup build -Ducd_path=/usr/share/unicode/ucd/
$ cd build/
$ ninja
$ meson install --destdir /tmp/TEST
```

I'm using these versions of software:
- meson 1.4.1
- libxml 2.13.4
- libxslt 1.1.42
- gtk-doc 1.34.0
- docbook-xsl 1.79.2
- ninja 1.11.1

note.body: It apparently needs `gtk-doc` fully installed.

target_title: The devhelp2 file is not generated

note.body:
For gucharmap, DevHelp file get generated and installed.

```
$ git clone git@ssh.gitlab.gnome.org:GNOME/gucharmap.git
$ cd gucharmap/
gucharmap/build$ meson setup build -Ducd_path=ucd
gucharmap$ cd build/
build$ ninja
ahmed@inspiron:~/work/gucharmap/build$ meson install --destdir /tmp/
build$ file /tmp/usr/local/share/gtk-doc/html/gucharmap-2.90/gucharmap-2.90.devhelp2 
/tmp/usr/local/share/gtk-doc/html/gucharmap-2.90/gucharmap-2.90.devhelp2: XML 1.0 document, Unicode text, UTF-8 text
```

I see in you log that `/data/builds/oi-userland/…/docs/reference/html/gucharmap.devhelp2` couldn't be found. The name is `gucharmap-2.90.devhelp2` and not `gucharmap.devhelp2` 
because of the `module_version` parameter given to `gnome.gtkdoc()`.

What am I missing?

target_title: The devhelp2 file is not generated
mkdb: Escape <> characters in annotations

note.body:
Annotations are part of the code, not part of the documentation.
They could contain the characters they want. GTK-Doc has no say in their syntax.
But since, XML is produced, XML special characters must be escaped on output.

Annotations should not be passed to [ConvertXMLChars()](gtkdoc/mkdb.py#L2593) on input and 
should be passed to [`CreateValidSGML`()](gtkdoc/mkdb.py#L2573) on output.

See https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk-doc/-/issues/133#note_2240626.

This MR does part of the job.
`(type Glist <int>)` will show up right, but not `(type Glist < int >)`.

It also add a test which is good thing.

target_title: mkdb: Escape <> characters in annotations

note.body:
Generalize:

            annotation = CreateValidSGML(annotation)

or:

            annotation = xml.sax.saxutils.escape(annotation)

target_title: Generate valid DocBook 4.5
Add gobject example source code to path for mkhtml test

note.body:
```suggestion:-4+0
    '--path=@0@'.format(srcdir / 'tests' / 'gobject' / 'examples'),
```

And the comment of the commit mentions GCC. It is not concerned at all by the issue.

target_title: Add gobject example source code to path for mkhtml test

note.body: Sure thing. Any changes I should make?

target_title: Add gobject example source code to path for mkhtml test
Adopt PEP-8 Code Style
Documentation: Character Entity Code (&) is shown instead of actual character (&)

note.body:
This issue and what MR !71 tries to solve have the same origin.

XML special characters are escaped on input and output with an exaggerated 
focus on DocBook.

On output, the escaping is systematic, done right: Character data must be
escaped in DocBook XML. As an exception (a bug), annotations are not escaped.
That is the reason for MR !71.

On input, weird [mkdb.ConvertXMLChars()](gtkdoc/mkdb.py#L2593-2665) is used.
It doesn't escape what looks like an XML tag or entity.
It is supposed to leave Markdown code spans intact, 
failing with `` `{ tmp = *atomic; *atomic &= val; return tmp; }` `` (issue #133). 
It escapes annotations which are part of the code, not part of the documentation;
`` `(type GList< int >)` `` is OK but not `` `(type GList<int>)` ``.
Even when a comment says “this is done unconditionally”, it makes its stew.
This function tries to be too smart.

XML escaping should only occur when necessary, DocBook output.
Input should be taken as-is. ConvertXMLChars() should be thrown.
Its purpose is unclear and unfulfilled.
If one of these days, GTK-Doc moves to an alternate output format, 
input will have to change. This is bad coupling.
Instead of fixing an issue here, another one there, we should review the
structure as a whole, decouple input, processing and output. 
A vision of a DocBook-less  GTK-Doc helps.

target_title: Build system examples
Tests: Content files without build system integration
Tests: Content files without build system integration

note.body:
Issue #150, `<xi:include href="../../examples/gobject.c" />`
in a GTK-Doc comment block causes:
```
../xml/object.xml:139: element include: XInclude error :
could not load ../../examples/gobject.c, and no fallback was found
```

This MR considers `examples/gobject.c` as a content file.

Content files are part of the documentation, not the code.
`example/gobject.c` does not belong in the documentation. It is not a 
content file.

MR !74 corrected the `gtkdoc-mkhtml` `--path` option.
It is a better MR than this one.
Besides fixing the issue, it keeps the only test of the `--path` option.

I wish MR !74 would reopen.

target_title: Add gobject example source code to path for mkhtml test

note.body:
@neil, can you please reopen MR !74?

Working more on issue #150, I come to the conclusion that this MR is better than [mine](!80).

target_title: Add gobject example source code to path for mkhtml test

note.body:
Ultimately, 
`<xi:include ... href="gobject.c" />`
is as obscure than
`<xi:include ... href="../../examples/gobject.c" />`.

So there is no need to change anything. 
My suggestion was not well informed.
